Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2010 04:19PM Caroljl wrote: Hi Kelly, sorry to hear about you and cancer, but you came to the right place for questions to be answered,or just to vent, I am sure glad I did. Just one thing to really say is to make sure if possible, to bring someone with you to your appts, my ex husband comes with me and it s sure great to have a second pair of ears. What you don't hear, that second person will. I think I am going to start chemo in the next couple of wks also.  Keep in touch ok    Carol

Recently Diagnosed - Need Strength and Encouragement BLC momand2kids

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2010 09:03AM Caroljl wrote: Hi Liz, please put me on your list, I am honored to be on this list with so many brave women, It makes you realize you are not alone.June 30th, I was told I have breast cancer and the next few weeks are really a blur,but slowly they are now clearing as far as treatments. I was diagnosed with IDC Stage 1 Grade 3 ER-PR neg.Her2+. Had partial mastectomy on July 16th and had my port put in on Aug 3rd and had my first chemo treatment on Aug. 4th. So far no side effects except for being tired, and not being able to sleep at night. I am keeping a log on my side effects as they occur.
Posts.Title: August 2010...anyone starting chemo besides me?! 1WonderWoman 1WonderWoman

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2010 09:12AM Caroljl wrote: Hi Mmahle, same as you! feeling pretty good, just so worn out and can't sleep at night.As far as the food, its ok for me yet.This is my third day in. Sure hope we get some sleep soon, good luck Mmahle
Posts.Title: August 2010...anyone starting chemo besides me?! 1WonderWoman 1WonderWoman

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2010 12:22PM Caroljl wrote: Hi  BLC, sorry to have to meet you here, but you will be happy you came. I, just like you, have been recently diagnosed with BC. I thought my world was coming to a huge crash, but as the days came and went, I realized I was not alone, these posts have been a god sent for me, don't get me wrong, my family is behind me in all of my decisions, but reading these posts made me realize, life is not crashing in on me. I had a partial mastectomy week and a half ago, and I am mostly pain free, I guess it helps knowing that the horrible cancer invading my body is gone!! Take ONE DAY at a time with your planning,take someone with you at your BS,or others appts. it helps having a second set of ears to understand what is planned for your treatments. Like today, my visiting nurse is coming and maybe I can get my drain removed, and that is it for today. Let your children know whats going on, you will be surprised how they will help. keep in touch ok
Posts.Title: Recently Diagnosed - Need Strength and Encouragement BLC momand2kids

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2011 08:55PM Caroljl wrote: I am so sorry for your pain you are  feeling. I wish God would make it better for people that are loved by one and another as it sounds like your family is. I am hoping that Kimberly has some good and peas-full times right now for the holidays, i know she does not want her pain to be remembered on her holiday season. I am so glad that my cancer was taken care of early enough, that my family can celebrate this holiday season. My prayers are with Kimerly and her loving family, I wish her all the comfort she needs. DAM THIS CANCER, enough is enough!!!!
Posts.Title: Long time since I posted, not goog news dhmeiser scuttlers

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2012 08:03PM Caroljl wrote: Hello to you Dave, and your family. You are a beautiful husband to go through Kimberly's illness with her. I hope you know that Kimberly is still going to be with you and your children, there is a Heaven and the Lord is with all of you now, whether you are in Heaven or on this earth. I am cured of cancer for 1 year, but there is still times that I wish I could switch places with Kimberly, she is a precious woman and should stay with her family. My heart is with you Dave.
